description: Creative techniques database for brainstorming facilitation

categories.name: Collaborative
categories.description: Team dynamics, diverse voices, building together

techniques.name: Yes And Building
techniques.description: Build ideas through affirmative contribution, accepting and expanding on others' ideas
prompts: What can we add to make this even better?
Yes, and we could also...
Building on that idea, what if we...

techniques.name: Brain Writing Round Robin
techniques.description: Silent written ideation passed between participants, allowing introverts to contribute equally
prompts: Write your idea silently, then pass it on
Read the previous idea and add a new angle
Build or branch from what you received

techniques.name: Random Stimulation
techniques.description: Use random words, images, or objects to spark unexpected connections
prompts: How does this random word connect to our challenge?
What if our solution had qualities of this object?
Force a connection between this stimulus and your problem

techniques.name: Role Playing
techniques.description: Adopt stakeholder perspectives to understand different viewpoints
prompts: If you were the customer, what would frustrate you?
How would a competitor view this situation?
What would your harshest critic say?

techniques.name: Ideation Relay Race
techniques.description: Time-boxed rapid ideation passed between team members for high-energy breakthrough
prompts: You have 60 seconds - generate as many ideas as possible!
Pass to the next person and build on their momentum
No filtering - quantity over quality in this round

techniques.name: What If Scenarios
techniques.description: Explore hypothetical situations to challenge assumptions and discover new possibilities
prompts: What if money was no object?
What if we had to solve this in 24 hours?
What if our biggest constraint disappeared?
What if we did the exact opposite?

techniques.name: Analogical Thinking
techniques.description: Transfer solutions from one domain to another through systematic comparison
prompts: What industry has already solved a similar problem?
How would nature handle this challenge?
What can we learn from how X approaches this?

techniques.name: Reversal Inversion
techniques.description: Flip assumptions and approaches upside down to reveal hidden possibilities
prompts: What if we did the exact opposite?
What assumptions are we taking for granted?
How would this look if we reversed the process?

techniques.name: First Principles Thinking
techniques.description: Break down problems to fundamental truths and rebuild from scratch
prompts: What do we know to be absolutely true?
Why does it have to be this way?
If we started from zero, what would we build?

techniques.name: Forced Relationships
techniques.description: Combine unrelated concepts to create unexpected innovations
prompts: How could we combine X with Y?
What if this product met that service?
Force these two unrelated concepts together

techniques.name: Time Shifting
techniques.description: View the problem from different time perspectives - past, present, future
prompts: How would this be solved 100 years ago?
What will people think of this in 50 years?
If you came from the future, what would you change?

techniques.name: Metaphor Mapping
techniques.description: Use metaphors to understand complex concepts and generate new insights
prompts: If this problem were a weather pattern, what would it be?
What animal represents our current situation?
Map this challenge to a journey - where are we?

techniques.name: Cross-Pollination
techniques.description: Import ideas and practices from completely different industries
prompts: How does the hospitality industry handle this?
What can we learn from gaming companies?
What would a restaurant do differently?

techniques.name: Concept Blending
techniques.description: Merge two or more concepts to create entirely new categories
prompts: What new category emerges when we blend these?
Create a name for this hybrid concept
What properties does this blend inherit from each parent?

techniques.name: Reverse Brainstorming
techniques.description: Generate ways to cause the problem, then reverse them into solutions
prompts: How could we make this problem worse?
What would guarantee failure?
Now reverse each failure mode into a success strategy

techniques.name: Sensory Exploration
techniques.description: Engage all five senses to unlock multi-dimensional thinking
prompts: What does success look like? Sound like? Feel like?
How would you describe this to someone using only textures?
What taste or smell represents this experience?

categories.name: Deep
categories.description: Root cause analysis, systematic exploration, deep understanding

techniques.name: Five Whys
techniques.description: Drill down to root causes by asking 'why' repeatedly
prompts: Why is this happening?
And why is that?
What's the root cause beneath the surface?

techniques.name: Morphological Analysis
techniques.description: Systematically combine variations across multiple dimensions
prompts: What are all the possible variations of dimension X?
Create a matrix of all possible combinations
Which unusual combinations might work?

techniques.name: Provocation Technique
techniques.description: Make deliberately provocative statements to escape conventional thinking
prompts: What if the opposite were true?
Imagine this absurd scenario...
What provocative statement challenges our assumptions?

techniques.name: Assumption Reversal
techniques.description: Identify and systematically reverse key assumptions
prompts: List all assumptions we're making
What if this assumption were false?
Reverse each assumption and explore implications

techniques.name: Question Storming
techniques.description: Generate questions instead of answers to reframe the problem
prompts: What questions should we be asking?
What question, if answered, would unlock everything?
What are we not asking that we should be?

techniques.name: Constraint Mapping
techniques.description: Identify, categorize, and strategically challenge constraints
prompts: What constraints are real vs. assumed?
Which constraint, if removed, would change everything?
How might we work around this limitation?

techniques.name: Failure Analysis
techniques.description: Study past failures to extract lessons and avoid repetition
prompts: What has failed before in similar situations?
What can we learn from this failure?
How do we ensure we don't repeat this?

techniques.name: Emergent Thinking
techniques.description: Allow ideas to evolve organically through iteration and connection
prompts: What patterns are emerging from our ideas?
Let this concept develop naturally - where does it want to go?
What connections are forming between ideas?

techniques.name: SCAMPER Method
techniques.description: Systematic creativity through seven lenses: Substitute, Combine, Adapt, Modify, Put to other uses, Eliminate, Reverse
prompts: What could we Substitute?
What could we Combine?
How could we Adapt this?
What could we Modify or Magnify?
What other uses could this have?
What could we Eliminate?
What if we Reversed or Rearranged?

techniques.name: Six Thinking Hats
techniques.description: Explore topics from six distinct perspectives: facts, emotions, caution, benefits, creativity, process
prompts: White Hat: What are the facts?
Red Hat: What are your gut feelings?
Black Hat: What could go wrong?
Yellow Hat: What are the benefits?
Green Hat: What creative alternatives exist?
Blue Hat: What's our process?

techniques.name: Mind Mapping
techniques.description: Visual organization of ideas radiating from a central concept
prompts: What's the central concept?
What main branches emerge from this?
What sub-branches connect to each main idea?
What unexpected connections do you see?

techniques.name: Resource Constraints
techniques.description: Apply extreme constraints to force creative solutions
prompts: What if you had only 10% of the budget?
How would you do this in one day?
What if you could only use one tool?

techniques.name: Decision Tree Mapping
techniques.description: Map out decision paths and their consequences systematically
prompts: What's the first decision point?
What branches from each choice?
Where does each path ultimately lead?

techniques.name: Solution Matrix
techniques.description: Evaluate solutions against criteria in a structured matrix
prompts: What criteria matter most?
How does each solution score on each criterion?
What patterns emerge from the matrix?

techniques.name: Trait Transfer
techniques.description: Borrow successful traits from exemplars and apply them to your challenge
prompts: Who does this exceptionally well?
What specific traits make them successful?
How can we adapt these traits to our context?

categories.name: Introspective Delight
categories.description: Inner exploration, values clarification, personal insight

techniques.name: Inner Child Conference
techniques.description: Access childlike curiosity and wonder to break adult constraints
prompts: What would 8-year-old you think of this?
If you could ask 'why' without limits, what would you ask?
What would be the most fun solution?

techniques.name: Shadow Work Mining
techniques.description: Explore rejected ideas and hidden assumptions from your subconscious
prompts: What ideas did you immediately dismiss?
What are you avoiding thinking about?
What would you suggest if no one was watching?

techniques.name: Values Archaeology
techniques.description: Dig deep to uncover core values driving decisions and preferences
prompts: Why does this matter to you?
What value does this serve?
What would you regret not doing?

techniques.name: Future Self Interview
techniques.description: Consult with your future self for long-term perspective
prompts: What would 10-years-from-now you advise?
Looking back, what would you wish you'd done?
What will matter in the long run?

techniques.name: Body Wisdom Dialogue
techniques.description: Access intuitive knowledge through physical and emotional awareness
prompts: What does your gut tell you?
Where do you feel resistance in your body?
What does excitement feel like with this option?

techniques.name: Permission Giving
techniques.description: Explicitly grant permission to think freely and remove self-imposed limits
prompts: You have permission to think the unthinkable
What would you do if failure was impossible?
What if all criticism was suspended?

techniques.name: Time Travel Talk Show
techniques.description: Interview people from different eras about your challenge
prompts: What would Leonardo da Vinci say about this?
How would a future historian view our decision?
Interview someone from 1920 about this challenge

techniques.name: Alien Anthropologist
techniques.description: View the situation as a complete outsider with no preconceptions
prompts: If you just arrived from another planet, what would confuse you?
What would seem completely illogical to an outsider?
Describe this situation as if seeing it for the first time

techniques.name: Dream Fusion Laboratory
techniques.description: Combine dream logic with practical goals for unexpected solutions
prompts: If this were a dream, what would happen next?
What impossible thing would solve this instantly?
Describe your ideal outcome in dream-like terms

techniques.name: Emotion Orchestra
techniques.description: Explore the problem through different emotional lenses
prompts: How does this look through the lens of joy?
What does fear reveal about this situation?
What would anger want to change here?

techniques.name: Parallel Universe Cafe
techniques.description: Explore alternate realities where different choices were made
prompts: In a universe where we chose differently, what happened?
What does success look like in an alternate reality?
Visit three parallel universes - what's different in each?

techniques.name: Persona Journey
techniques.description: Walk through the experience as different archetypal characters
prompts: Experience this as The Skeptic
Now try it as The Enthusiast
What does The Expert notice that others miss?

categories.name: Wild
categories.description: Extreme thinking, boundary breaking, chaos embracing

techniques.name: Chaos Engineering
techniques.description: Deliberately introduce chaos to discover hidden strengths and weaknesses
prompts: What if everything went wrong at once?
Introduce chaos - what survives?
What breaks first and what does that tell us?

techniques.name: Guerrilla Gardening Ideas
techniques.description: Plant ideas in unexpected places and see what grows
prompts: Where could this idea take root unexpectedly?
Plant this concept somewhere it doesn't belong
What grows when we scatter ideas wildly?

techniques.name: Pirate Code Brainstorm
techniques.description: Ignore all rules and conventions - what would pirates do?
prompts: What rules would you break if you could?
What's the pirate approach to this problem?
If guidelines were suggestions, what would you do?

techniques.name: Zombie Apocalypse Planning
techniques.description: Plan for extreme scenarios to reveal essential priorities
prompts: If everything collapsed, what would still matter?
What's the minimum viable version?
What would you protect at all costs?

techniques.name: Drunk History Retelling
techniques.description: Explain the situation without filters or formality
prompts: Explain this like you're telling a friend at a bar
What's the unfiltered version of this story?
Drop all corporate speak - what's really going on?

techniques.name: Anti-Solution
techniques.description: Design the worst possible solution, then learn from it
prompts: Design the worst possible version of this
What would guarantee failure?
What does the anti-solution teach us about success?

techniques.name: Quantum Superposition
techniques.description: Hold contradictory ideas simultaneously until observation collapses them
prompts: What if both opposing options were true?
Hold these contradictions together - what emerges?
Don't choose yet - explore the superposition

techniques.name: Elemental Forces
techniques.description: Apply metaphors of fire, water, earth, and air to the challenge
prompts: What does Fire want to transform here?
Where does Water want to flow?
What does Earth want to ground?
What does Air want to lift up?

categories.name: Biomimetic
categories.description: Nature-inspired solutions, biological wisdom, ecosystem thinking

techniques.name: Nature's Solutions
techniques.description: Look to nature for time-tested solutions to complex problems
prompts: How has nature solved this problem?
What biological system faces similar challenges?
What would 3.8 billion years of R&D suggest?

techniques.name: Ecosystem Thinking
techniques.description: View the problem as part of an interconnected ecosystem
prompts: What are all the organisms in this ecosystem?
What symbiotic relationships exist or could exist?
What happens to the whole system if we change this part?

techniques.name: Evolutionary Pressure
techniques.description: Apply selection pressure to evolve ideas toward fitness
prompts: What selection pressures should we apply?
Which ideas survive under these conditions?
How would this idea need to adapt to thrive?

categories.name: Quantum
categories.description: Quantum-inspired thinking, uncertainty embrace, observer effects

techniques.name: Observer Effect
techniques.description: Explore how observation and measurement change what we're studying
prompts: How does measuring this change it?
What happens when we stop observing?
How does our perspective affect what we see?

techniques.name: Entanglement Thinking
techniques.description: Discover hidden connections between seemingly unrelated elements
prompts: What distant elements are secretly connected?
If we change this, what else changes instantly?
What's entangled that we haven't noticed?

techniques.name: Superposition Collapse
techniques.description: Use constraints to collapse possibilities into concrete decisions
prompts: What constraint would force a decision?
If we had to choose right now, what would we pick?
What observation collapses our options into action?

categories.name: Cultural
categories.description: Cross-cultural wisdom, traditional knowledge, fusion thinking

techniques.name: Indigenous Wisdom
techniques.description: Apply traditional knowledge and long-term thinking to modern challenges
prompts: What would seven generations thinking suggest?
How have traditional cultures approached this?
What wisdom have we forgotten?

techniques.name: Fusion Cuisine
techniques.description: Blend approaches from different cultures for unique combinations
prompts: What would happen if we blended Eastern and Western approaches?
Create a fusion of two cultural perspectives
What unexpected cultural combination might work?

techniques.name: Ritual Innovation
techniques.description: Design meaningful rituals and experiences that mark important moments
prompts: What ritual could mark this transition?
How do we make this moment meaningful?
What ceremony would honor this change?

techniques.name: Mythic Frameworks
techniques.description: Apply archetypal stories and mythic patterns to understand situations
prompts: What myth or story does this situation resemble?
Who is the hero, the mentor, the shadow?
What archetypal journey are we on?

energyLevels.high: Requires active engagement, enthusiasm, and creative energy
energyLevels.low: Reflective, introspective, suitable for quiet exploration
